title.value: Genetic landscape of an in vivo protein interactome
title.justification: The provided paper's title is from the extraction.
title.quote: Genetic landscape of an in vivo protein interactome

extractions.description: The paper explores how genome-wide genetic variations affect protein-protein interactions (PPIs) in inbred strains of Saccharomyces cerevisiae. By mapping these interactions, the research aims to define the biochemical mechanisms underlying complex polygenic traits, utilizing a combination of experimental techniques, including Protein-fragment Complementation Assay (PCA) and genome-wide association studies (GWAS), to uncover the influences of genetic and environmental perturbations on PPIs.

type.justification: The paper involves conducting experiments, such as PPIs measurements and GWAS analyses, in inbred yeast strains to derive conclusions.
type.quote: Here, we measured 61 PPIs in inbred strains of Saccharomyces cerevisiae with ~12,000 single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) across the genome.

name.justification: The paper focuses on the genetic landscape and the effects of SNPs on protein interactomes, which falls under the genomics research field.
name.quote: We hypothesized that PPI networks integrate genetic and environmental effects, potentially defining biochemical mechanisms underlying complex polygenic traits.

name.justification: The study heavily focuses on the interactions between proteins in relation to genetic variations.
name.quote: Protein-protein interaction (PPI) networks accurately map environmental perturbations to their molecular consequences in cells.

name.justification: Genomic data analysis and association mapping are conducted using bioinformatics tools and methods.
name.quote: We performed SNP to PPI association mapping analysis by linear regression at each SNP locus.

name.justification: The dataset comprises 354 inbred yeast strains from a GWAS study used for PPI measurements.
name.quote: We used a collection of 354 haploid yeast strains used in a previous GWAS study that resulted from the inbreeding of two divergent strains for 6 generations leading to a cohort with minimal linkage disequilibrium (LD).

referenced_paper_title.value: Mapping Causal Variants with Single-Nucleotide Resolution Reveals Biochemical Drivers of Phenotypic Change
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced as the source of the inbred yeast strains used for the GWAS study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The population cohort in this study consisted of 354 haploid inbred strains of S. cerevisiae previously constructed and genotyped by She and Jarosz for a GWAS study.

name.justification: The annotation of the genomic features, gene elements, and non-coding RNAs in the study is based on this database.
name.quote: To determine the genomic elements on which the 12,054 SNPs are located, we obtained the annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD).

referenced_paper_title.value: Annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD)
referenced_paper_title.justification: The database provides a referenced genome's annotation used in the analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To determine the genomic elements on which the 12,054 SNPs are located, we obtained the annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD) (version R 64-3-1 released on 2021-04-27).

name.justification: Matrix eQTL was used for linear regression in SNP to PPI association mapping.
name.quote: Our first piQTL approach (approach 1) relied on a simple linear regression model implemented in Matrix eQTL.

referenced_paper_title.value: Matrix eQTL: Ultra fast eQTL analysis via large matrix operations
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper is referenced for describing the tools used in eQTL analysis.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our first piQTL approach (approach 1) relied on a simple linear regression model implemented in Matrix eQTL.

name.justification: rMVP was used for genome-wide association study with a more comprehensive model incorporating kinship matrix.
name.quote: Our second piQTL approach (approach 2) modeled the relationship between the genotype and the a phenotype (PPI) using a generalized linear model implemented in rMVP.

referenced_paper_title.value: rMVP: A Memory-efficient, Visualization-enhanced, and Parallel-accelerated Tool for Genome-wide Association Study
referenced_paper_title.justification: This paper describes the usage of rMVP for genome-wide association studies.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Our second piQTL approach (approach 2) modeled the relationship between the genotype and the a phenotype (PPI) using a generalized linear model implemented in rMVP.

name.justification: The Saccharomyces Genome Database is used for obtaining the annotated reference genome for the study.
name.quote: To determine the genomic elements on which the 12,054 SNPs are located, we obtained the annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD).

referenced_paper_title.value: Annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD)
referenced_paper_title.justification: The SGD provides the referenced annotated genome for the research.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To determine the genomic elements on which the 12,054 SNPs are located, we obtained the annotated reference genome of S. cerevisiae from the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD) (version R 64-3-1 released on 2021-04-27).
